sentence.text: I am willing to forgive people who have upset me and do not bear grudges against them .
There 's always people out there ready and willing to nick them .
It may be a case for argument that people are less willing to accept patronising notions from people in superior positions .
On April 23 President Alfredo Cristiani Burkard stated that the government would be willing to guarantee the integration of the FMLN into national life .
Sandra Maggs of Fimbra , who is organising the concert , is looking for firms or companies which would be willing either to provide sponsorship or to buy up a number of tickets for staff and guests .
Nevertheless , Japanese companies seem as willing to sell technology , or collaborate on its development , as any other firms , when doing so offers them some advantage .
Nor have the courts seemed willing to take on this task .
Her watch had stopped and she was n't sure exactly what time it was , but she was willing to bet Fen had made the most of his opportunities .
At least music lovers have made it known they 're no longer willing to part with money for nothing .
` The spirit is willing but the flesh is very , very weak . "
These days there is a plethora of organisations willing and generally able to lend us money .

GRAHAM Taylor 's players are willing to play for nothing in England 's World Cup ties -- starting with Norway at Wembley on October 14 .
Are you willing to forgive and put them behind you ?

The teachers are willing to back each other up .
The fact that the government was willing to sign a new peace agreement was its concession .
A bank will usually be willing to send deeds to you upon your giving its undertaking on its standard forms .
Rocastle looked willing , but his first touch let him down on occasions ( still rusty I suppose ) .
He was clearly preoccupied but Miss Huntley was not willing to let him go .
